intro: Isopyrum ohwianum, commonly known as the Korean sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Korea and northeastern China. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Isopyrum ohwianum is often found in moist, open habitats such as stream banks and meadows.
